intro: Marcetia canescens, commonly known as the silver-haired orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in woodland habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a valuable species for conservation and botanical study.
